abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Road Maintenance Project
            for Albania were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the
            risk to development outcome was high, the Bank performance
            was satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: The
            selection of the project's rural roads was done by a
            consultant study, which started by collecting a list of
            priorities from the Circles and the Communes. At
            implementation, while the procurement process was
            centralized by General Roads Directorate (GRD), every
            individual contract was signed by a senior authority in the
            Ministry of Local Governments or its successor the Ministry
            of Interior (MI). Yet, during project implementation and
            even at project closing there are indications of unhappiness
            in the MI that selection was not always the highest
            priority. There is also unhappiness with the design
            standard, where an asphalt surface was desired. This
            situation points to the need for a stronger participation of
            the local communities and the MI in all stages of the
            project cycle. It also points to the need for an even
            stronger participation or consultation with the MI or local
            authorities when such authorities change during the course
            of the project. In fact, part of the perception of the
            current MI authorities may stem from the fact that many
            decisions were taken by the preceding authorities. Lack of
            ownership, if real, may have serious consequences when the
            road improvement or maintenance work is completed, and it is
            up to the local authorities to assume responsibility for the
            maintenance of the roads.

5085575.majtheme: Social protection and risk management,Rural development

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Road
            Maintenance Project is to reduce transport costs on priority
            sections of the main road network, reduce accident rates,
            and provide better access to, and basic services for rural
            areas. The two main project components are: 1) Civil works
            will conduct periodic, and routine maintenance on paved
            roads of the national road network, including urban
            sections. Routine maintenance works will be contracted by
            the private sector, to include pavement, drainage systems,
            road signaling maintenance works during an overall period of
            three years. Periodic maintenance works on pavement, and
            bridges of the rural road network, shall be based on an
            engineering analysis, and assessment of socioeconomic
            conditions. Under this component, equipment for road
            surveys, vehicles, office equipment, and computers will be
            supplied. Training and technical assistance (TA) will be
            provided for the restructuring, management organization and
            systems of the main national and rural roads, which includes
            design and recommendations on road user charges,
            disbursement mechanisms, and financing. 2) Traffic safety
            remedial works will include horizontal, and vertical
            signalization, improvements of road pavement and shoulders,
            and installation of roadside barriers, and bridge parapets.
            Hardware and software will provide database and analysis
            systems to the Traffic Police to facilitate road safety
            measures, and, TA and training will support these efforts.

1802687.trustfund:
TF038565-ALBANIA:  ROAD MAINTENANCE,TF038559-ALBANIA:  ROAD MAINTENANCE,TF023878-ALBANIA ROADS MAINTENANCE PROJECT,TF040786-ALBANIA: ROAD MAINTENANCE,TF040371-ALBANIA - SUPERVISION,

repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Road Maintenance Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment comprises
            two volumes, the environmental action plan, which lays the
            foundation to proactively improve the environment, and, the
            environmental management plan, which stipulates the
            mitigation measures that will ensure adequate environmental
            protection. The design phase shall consider project selected
            roads for routine maintenance works, limited to the existing
            right-of-way, and, include waste collection in accordance to
            current regulations. In case of archaeological finds, the
            related archaeological authorities shall be informed, who
            should proceed to its preservation. Procurement documents
            will include provisions to ensure embankment stabilization,
            particularly around bridges, and culverts, through
            re-vegetation practices, and technologies to contain
            unstable slope terrains; while drainage discharges will be
            monitored to reduce erosion. During construction,
            contracting precautionary clauses shall specify the required
            materials - from asphalt plants, stone quarries, and borrow
            pits - to be environmentally valid, and licensed for use.
            Transport, and operating equipment will be required to use
            covers, or spray truck loads, which should be transported at
            off peak hours to minimize traffic congestion. Construction
            activities will be limited to daylight working schedules, to
            reduce noise, and dust pollution. Construction debris will
            be disposed of in accordance to local environmental
            regulations, and at selected sites, while sediments, and
            solid wastes will undergo toxicity testing prior to
            appropriate disposal. During the operation phase, periodic
            maintenance will be subjected to a Safety Audit, and a
            review process by the consultant road safety specialist, in
            line with a road workers protection policy to be adopted.

display_title.display_title:
Albania - Road Maintenance
            Project : environmental assessment : Environmental action plan

1715991.trustfund:
TF038565-ALBANIA:  ROAD MAINTENANCE,TF038559-ALBANIA:  ROAD MAINTENANCE,TF023878-ALBANIA ROADS MAINTENANCE PROJECT,TF040786-ALBANIA: ROAD MAINTENANCE,TF040371-ALBANIA - SUPERVISION,
            PREPARATION OF EMERGENCY ROAD REPAIR PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Road Maintenance Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment comprises
            two volumes, the environmental action plan, which lays the
            foundation to proactively improve the environment, and, the
            environmental management plan, which stipulates the
            mitigation measures that will ensure adequate environmental
            protection. The design phase shall consider project selected
            roads for routine maintenance works, limited to the existing
            right-of-way, and, include waste collection in accordance to
            current regulations. In case of archaeological finds, the
            related archaeological authorities shall be informed, who
            should proceed to its preservation. Procurement documents
            will include provisions to ensure embankment stabilization,
            particularly around bridges, and culverts, through
            re-vegetation practices, and technologies to contain
            unstable slope terrains; while drainage discharges will be
            monitored to reduce erosion. During construction,
            contracting precautionary clauses shall specify the required
            materials - from asphalt plants, stone quarries, and borrow
            pits - to be environmentally valid, and licensed for use.
            Transport, and operating equipment will be required to use
            covers, or spray truck loads, which should be transported at
            off peak hours to minimize traffic congestion. Construction
            activities will be limited to daylight working schedules, to
            reduce noise, and dust pollution. Construction debris will
            be disposed of in accordance to local environmental
            regulations, and at selected sites, while sediments, and
            solid wastes will undergo toxicity testing prior to
            appropriate disposal. During the operation phase, periodic
            maintenance will be subjected to a Safety Audit, and a
            review process by the consultant road safety specialist, in
            line with a road workers protection policy to be adopted.

display_title.display_title:
Albania - Road Maintenance
            Project : environmental assessment (Vol. 2) : Environmental
            management plan
